page.title: 05BIRD LIFE IN HOOLE
page.content: IN THE HALF MILE COUNTRY ROAD LEADING TO HAMMOND SCHOOL,HOOLE BANK,THERE ARE 50 SPECIES OF BIRDS WHICH INCLUDE THE HOUSE SPARROW,BLUE TIT,HEDGE SPARROW, WREN,SONGTHRUSH,SWIFT,SWALLOW CUCKOO, GULL,BLACKBIRD,MAGPIE,COLLARD DOVE. SOME OF THE UNCOMMON BIRDS ARE YELLOW WAGTAIL,NUTHATCH,TREE CREEPER,AND GREATER SPOTTED WOODPECKER.THE REDWING AND FIELDFARE ARE ALSO FOUND,THESE COME FROM SCANDINAVIA. MOORHENS COULD ONCE HAVE BEEN SEEN IN A SMALL BROOK, BUT WHEN THE M53 MOTORWAY WAS BUILT THE BROOK WAS FILLED IN AND THE MOORHENS HAVE GONE.THERE ARE FEWER SKYLARKS AS SOME TREES WERE FELLED FOR THE MOTORWAY AND SOME ELM TREES HAVE DIED FROM DUTCH ELM DISEASE SO REDUCING THE NUMBER OF NESTING PLACES FOR THE BIRDS.
